seg.source: Betriebswerk Pressig war Heimat der Schubloks
seg.translation: The Pressig depotwas home to the thrust locomotives
Pressig depot was home to the heavy goods locomotive
Pressig depot was the home of the push-pull engines

seg.source: Das Bahnbetriebswerk in Pressig war jahrzehntelang die Drehscheibe im Frankenwald.
seg.translation: For decades the depot in Pressig was the hub of the Franconian Forest.
The Pressig rail depot was the hub of the Franconian forest for decades.
For decades, the railway depot in Pressig was the hub in the Franconian Forest.

seg.source: 1991 endete ein Stück Eisenbahn-Historie.
seg.translation: 1991 put an end to a piece of railway history.
1991 saw the end of a piece of railway history.
A piece of railway history ended in 1991.

seg.source: "Wenn Puffer an Puffer knallten, hörte man es in ganz Pressig", erinnert sich Georg Dinkel, der die Geschichte des Ortes und des Bahnhofs archiviert.
seg.translation: The crashing from bumper to bumper could be heard throughout Pressig, remembers Georg Dinkel, who archives the history of the place and the stations.
"You could hear the sound of buffers coming together all over Pressig", reminisced Georg Dinkel, who is archiving the history of the town and the railway station.
"When buffers popped against buffers, you could hear it all over Pressig," recalls Georg Dinkel, who archives the history of the place and the railway station.

seg.source: Das regte niemanden auf.
seg.translation: This did not bother anybody.
Nobody was annoyed by the sound.
No one was upset by that.

seg.source: Da quietschten auch die Bremsen und knatterten die Waggons.
seg.translation: The squeaking of brakes and rattling of carriages could also be heard.
The brakes screeched and the wagons rattled.
Then the brakes squealed and the wagons rattled.

seg.source: Das war eben Eisenbahn pur.
seg.translation: This was pure railway.
It was a pure railway sound experience.
That was just pure railway.

seg.source: Aussagen, die sinnbildlich für Dinkels Heimat Pressig stehen.
seg.translation: Statements that are symbolic for Dinkel’s Pressig homeland.
These statements sum up Dinkel's home town of Pressig.
Statements that are emblematic of Dinkel's homeland Pressig.

seg.source: Nirgendwo im Frankenwald wurde ein Ort so durch die Eisenbahn geprägt.
seg.translation: Nowhere in the Franconian forest has a place been characterized by the railway so much.
Nowhere in the Franconian forest has been so deeply influenced by the railways.
Nowhere in the Franconian Forest has a place been so shaped by the railway.

seg.source: Hier war der Ausgangspunkt der Steilrampen-Bergstrecke nach Norden, die nach einem Anstieg um etwa 220 Höhenmeter ihren Scheitelpunkt in Steinbach am Wald hat.
seg.translation: This was the starting point for the steep mountain section to the north, which peaks in Steinbach am Wald following an ascension of about 220 meters.
It was the starting point for the steep mountain route to the north, which reaches its peak in Steinbach am Wals at about 220 meters above sea level.
This was the starting point of the steep ramp mountain route to the north, which has its apex in Steinbach am Wald after an ascent of about 220 metres in altitude.

seg.source: Um das zu bewältigen, wurden früher Zug- und Schubloks benötigt, die in Pressig ihre Heimat hatten.
seg.translation: Previously trains and locomotives housed in Pressig were needed to handle this.
To climb to this peak, heavy goods locomotives were required, which had their home in Pressig.
In order to cope with this, train and drawer locomotives used to be needed, which had their home in Pressig.

seg.source: 1901 genehmigte der bayerische Landtag den Bau einer Bahnbetriebswerkstätte mit 21 Lokschuppen, Lehrlingswerkstätte, Fahrleitungs- und Bahnmeisterei.
seg.translation: In 1901 the Bavarian parliament approved the building of a depot with 21 locomotives, apprentice workshops, catenary and railroad maintenance division.
In 1901, the Bavarian state parliament approved the construction of a railway repair workshop with 21 engine sheds, an apprentice workshop and an overhead line and railway maintenance depots.
In 1901, the Bavarian state parliament approved the construction of a railway workshop with 21 locomotive sheds, apprentice workshop, catenary and railway maintenance.

seg.source: "Herzstück war die Drehscheibe, die nach einem Umbau 1899 einen Durchmesser von 18 Metern hatte", erzählt Norbert Heidrich aus Hirschaid, Bahnhistoriker und 47 Jahre lang Berufseisenbahner.
seg.translation: The centerpiece was the turntable, which after reconstruction in the year 1899 had a diameter of 18 metres, says Norbert Heidrich from Hirschaid, a railway historian and a professional railroader with 47 years of experience.

"At the heart of everything was the turntable, which, after conversion work in 1899, had a diameter of 18 meters", explains Norbert Heidrich from Hirschaid, railway historian and 47 year-long railway worker.

"The centrepiece was the turntable, which, after a conversion in 1899, had a diameter of 18 metres," says Norbert Heidrich from Hirschaid, a railway historian and professional railway worker for 47 years.

seg.source: Vom Bahnbetriebswerk (BW) Pressig, das 1968 Bamberg unterstellt wurde, wurden auch Loks für die Nebenstrecken Pressig - Tettau, Ludwigsstadt - Lehesten, Stockheim - Sonneberg und Kronach - Nordhalben betrieben.
seg.translation: The Pressig depot, which in the year 1968 was relocated to Bamberg, also operated locomotives for the branch lines Pressig - Tettau, Ludwigsstadt - Lehesten, Stockheim - Sonneberg and Kronach - Nordhalben.

From the Pressig railway workshop, brought under the control of Bamberg in 1968, locomotives ran on the local routes from Pressig to Tettau, Ludwigsstadt to Lehesten, Stockheim to Sonneberg and Kronach to Nordhalben.

The railway depot (BW) Pressig, which was subordinated to Bamberg in 1968, also operated locomotives for the branch lines Pressig - Tettau, Ludwigsstadt - Lehesten, Stockheim - Sonneberg and Kronach - Nordhalben.

seg.source: Am 15. Juli 1950 berichtete das "Volksblatt" von einem Personalbestand von 160 Mann; 13 Dampf- und acht Elloks waren damals in Pressig stationiert.
seg.translation: On July 15 1950 the "Volksblatt" reported of a staff of 160 men; 13 steam locomotives and eight electric locomotives were stationed in Pressig at that time.
On 15th July 1950, the "Volksblatt" news reported that the workshop had a staff of 160 men; at the time, 13 steam locomotives and 8 electric locomotives were stationed at Pressig.
On 15 July 1950, the "Volksblatt" reported a staff of 160; 13 steam and eight electric locomotives were stationed in Pressig at that time.

seg.source: Die Elektrifizierung der Strecke 1939 minimierte bereits den Bedarf an Zug- und Schubloks.
seg.translation: The electrification of the track in 1939 reduced the need for pulling trains and locomotives.
The electrification of the route in 1939 minimized the need for heavy goods locomotives.
The electrification of the line in 1939 already minimised the need for train and push locomotives.

seg.source: Ab 1977 wurden sie nur noch bei Güterzügen gebraucht.
seg.translation: From 1977 they were still used with freight trains.
From 1977, they were only used for freight.
From 1977, they were only used for freight trains.

seg.source: Bis 1991 wurden im Monat noch mindestens 10 000 Wägen rangiert.
seg.translation: By 1991 at least 10,000 wagons were shunted.
As recently as 1991, at least 10 000 wagons were shunted per month.
Until 1991, at least 10 000 wagons were still manoeuvred per month.

seg.source: 1982 wurden Teile des Betriebswerks, 1991 der Rest abgebrochen.
seg.translation: In 1982 the depot was partially dismantled and the remainder in the year 1991.
In 1982, part of the workshop was demolished, with the rest demolished in 1991.
Parts of the plant were demolished in 1982 and the rest in 1991.

seg.source: Heidrich: "Es ist bedauerlich, dass man nicht eine bessere Nutzung des Standortes, auch in puncto Güterverkehr, ins Auge gefasst hat".
seg.translation: Heidrich: ‘It’s a shame that better use of the location is not envisaged, also with regard to freight traffic’.
Heidrich: "It is a shame that nobody thought of a better use of the location, even as regards freight transport".
Heidrich: "It is regrettable that a better use of the site has not been envisaged, including in terms of freight transport."

seg.source: Noch an Pfingsten 1989 feierte die Bahndirektion Nürnberg zum Jubiläum "50 Jahre Elektrifizierung Nürnberg - Saalfeld" ein pompöses Bahnhofsfest in Pressig.
seg.translation: Still in the year 1989 at Pentecost, the Nuremberg Railway Directorate celebrated "50 years of electrification Nuremberg - Saalfeld" with a pompous station festival for the anniversary in Pressig.
On Pentecost in 1989, Nuremberg railway chiefs organised a grand celebration in Pressig to mark "50 years of electrification between Nuremberg - Saalfeld".
On Whitsun 1989, the Nuremberg Railway Directorate celebrated the anniversary of "50 years of electrification Nuremberg - Saalfeld" with a pompous station party in Pressig.

seg.source: "Da waren 10 000 begeisterte Zuschauer hier", erinnert sich Georg Dinkel.
seg.translation: 10,000 enthusiastic spectators were here, remembers Georg Dinkel.
"There was a crowd of 10,000 here", remembers Georg Dinkel.
"There were 10,000 enthusiastic spectators here," remembers Georg Dinkel.

seg.source: Wenig später das Aus.
seg.translation: Shortly afterwards.
Shortly afterwards, it was all over.
A short time later, the end.

seg.source: Am 1. Juni 1991 wurden die letzten 30 Mann abgezogen, der Rangierbahnhof Pressig war Geschichte.
seg.translation: On June 1, 1991 the last 30 men were withdrawn and the Pressig marshalling yard was history.
On 1st June 1991, the last 30 men were laid off and the Pressig shunting yard was history.
On 1 June 1991, the last 30 men were withdrawn, the Pressig marshalling yard was history.

seg.source: "Die Rangierer und Hemmschuhleger erledigten die schwierigsten Arbeiten im Zugverkehr", erinnert Dinkel.
seg.translation: The shunters and wheel scotches took care of the heaviest rail traffic work, remembers Dinkel.
"The shunters and brake fitters did the hardest jobs in transport", remembers Dinkel.
"The shunting and shoe-laying workers did the most difficult work in train traffic," Dinkel recalls.

seg.source: Jeder Fehlgriff hätte fatale Folgen gehabt.
seg.translation: Each mistake could have fatal consequences.
Every mistake could have fatal consequences.
Any misstep would have had fatal consequences.

seg.source: Warum der Bahnhof Pressig-Rothenkirchen für die Umkehr der Hierarchie der beiden Orte geführt hat und viele weitere historische und aktuelle Bilder gibt es hier im infrankenPlus-Artikel.
seg.translation: Why the Pressig-Rothenkirchen station led to a change in the hierarchy of both locations and how many more historical and current pictures there are, is included here in the infrankenPlus article.
In this infrankenPlus article, find out how the Pressig-Rothenkirchen station transformed the hierarchy of the two towns and see pictures from past and present.
Why the station Pressig-Rothenkirchen led to the reversal of the hierarchy of the two places and many other historical and current pictures can be found here in the infrankenPlus article.
